page.title: 15AN OLD LADY FROM TONBRIDGE:1
page.content: Selah was born in 1897 at 52 Ship_ bourne Road.It was a three bedroomed house with running water but there was no bathroom and the toilet was outside the back door.The home had fires in three rooms and was lit by oil lamps. When they wanted hot water it had to be heated in the kettle on the fire. There were six children in her family and Selah shared a room with her sis_ ter.Her father was a blacksmith and worked 12 hours a day.Her mother also had to work as a laundry maid. The family had meat to eat every day and all kinds of vegetables from their own garden and allotment.Her mother bought apples and pears,and milk in a jug from the farm. Selah now lives on her own but all her children live nearby.Her daughter helps her with the washing and shopp_ ing and she goes there every Sunday.
